intro: Lissochilus angolensis, commonly known as the Angola slipper orchid, is a species native to southern Africa, particularly Angola and Namibia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom during the warmer months, and its roots are adapted to store water in its native habitat. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
